profile.name: Domenic Denicola
profile.bio: Software developer in Tokyo, Japan. 🎌 Passionate about all things #ML and building intelligent systems. Learning out loud & sharing insights. 🤖💡

tweets.content: If your CI/CD pipeline takes longer than 15 minutes, you're doing it wrong. Fight me. #devops #cicd
Saw that huge outage at [Hypothetical Cloud Provider]. This is why distributed systems are both a marvel and a nightmare. Always plan for failure. #cloudcomputing #devops
Big win today: finally refactored that legacy component that's been haunting us for months. The code feels so much cleaner now. Small victories! ✨ #softwareengineer #refactoring
Unpopular opinion: Microservices are great for scaling *teams*, not just applications. If your team communication breaks down over a monolith, you've already lost. #softwaredevelopment #microservices
Managed to get basic user authentication working for my personal dashboard project. JWT tokens are tricky but powerful. Next up: data persistence! #learninginpublic #webdevelopment
My brain trying to remember if it's `Array.prototype.map` or `Array.map` for the 1000th time. Send coffee. ☕ #javascript #developerproblems
Thinking about picking up a 'good first issue' from a library I use daily. Anyone have tips for getting started with larger codebases in open source? #opensource #contribute
Diving into a new side project: building a tiny CLI tool to manage my dotfiles with Rust. Learning a ton about error handling and async patterns. Wish me luck! #RustLang #sideproject
The new VS Code update with improved remote development features looks amazing. Might finally convince me to ditch my local dev environment for some projects. #vscode #devtools
Just submitted my first PR to a small open-source project! Fixed a tiny typo in the docs, but it feels good to contribute. Every little bit helps! #opensource #contribution
Just spent 30 minutes debugging a feature only to realize I was on the wrong branch. Happens every time. 🤦‍♂️ #developerlife #git
Looking into state management libraries for a new React app. Torn between Zustand and React Query. Any recommendations or strong opinions for a medium-sized project? #reactjs #statemanagement
Frontend frameworks are getting so complex these days, it feels like we're constantly building abstractions on top of abstractions. Sometimes I miss vanilla JS. 🤔 #webdev #frontend
Had a great brainstorming session with the team today about scaling our main API. Lots of challenging but exciting ideas on the table. Love when things click! #teambuilding #architecture
The most impactful skill for a developer isn't just coding, it's learning how to learn. The tech landscape changes so fast, staying curious is key. #softwaredevelopment #lifelonglearning
My computer fan noise is directly correlated to the complexity of the current function I'm debugging. It's a precise metric. #programming #laptoplife
Discovered a neat little trick today with CSS custom properties for theming. It's so much more powerful than I gave it credit for initially! #css #webdesign #frontend
